newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisia grants Australia's BHP metals permit.
newsitem.headline: Tunisia grants Australia's BHP metals permit.

text.p: Tunisia has granted BHP Minerals, a subsidiary of Australian group Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd a permit for metals exploration in central Tunisia, an official at the Industry Ministry said on Monday.
The permit covers 2,300 square kilometres in the region of Kairouan and is for a renewable five-year period, he said.
BHP Minerals plans to invest over three million dollars for the exploration phase, the official added.
They said the exploration was for all kinds of metals.
The contract was signed last week in Tunis by Industry Minister Slaheddine Bouguerra and Roger Kuns, head of the exploration department in the Mediterranean/Africa region at BHP Minerals.
